data.title: Fight Club
data.solution:
# get a conversation and split it to get every word
conversation = input()
every_word = conversation.split()

# looking for a quantity of snaps
# if it's even - the last one is Narrator, if it's odd - Tyler, else - none of them
total = every_word.count('*Snap*')
if total == 0:
    print('None of them')
elif total%2 == 0:
    print('Narrator')
elif total%2 == 1:
    print('Tyler')
data.statement:
If you read the book or watched the movie "Fight Club" you know about Narrator and Tyler Durden. Even if didn't - don't worry, because this puzzle is easy to understand. When Narrator snaps his fingers, he stops talking and Tyler starts. When Tyler snaps his fingers, he stops talking and Narrator starts.
You are given a conversation between Narrator and Tyler, in which Narrator begins, and a snap is represented as {{*Snap*}}. You must find out who talks last.

Example: sentence {{*Snap*}} sentence
Here the last sentence is Tyler's.

testCases.testIn: Whoa, wait, this is crazy. You want me to hit you? *Snap* That’s right.

testCases.title: #1_V
testCases.testIn: This is crazy. *Snap* So go crazy. Let ‘er rip.
Oh, it's late. Hey, thanks for the beer. *Snap* Yeah, man. *Snap* I should find a hotel. *Snap* What? *Snap* What? *Snap* A hotel? *Snap* Yeah.

testCases.title: #2_V
testCases.testIn: Uh..I..I don't know. *Snap* You got it. *Snap* No...
It's a comforter... *Snap* It's a blanket.

testCases.title: #4_V
testCases.testIn: Can I stay at your place? *Snap* Yeah.

data.stubGenerator:
read CONVERSATION:string(1000)
write Who the last is
data.outputDescription: print {{Narrator}} if the last one was Narrator, {{Tyler}} if the last one was Tyler and If what you're given, has no snaps, it's not a conversation, but a monologue. In such cases, you must output {{None of them}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

If you read the book or watched the movie "Fight Club" you know about Narrator and Tyler Durden. Even if didn't - don't worry, because this puzzle is easy to understand. When Narrator snaps his fingers, he stops talking and Tyler starts. When Tyler snaps his fingers, he stops talking and Narrator starts.
You are given a conversation between Narrator and Tyler, in which Narrator begins, and a snap is represented as *Snap*. You must find out who talks last.

Example: sentence *Snap* sentence
Here the last sentence is Tyler's.
Input
Line 1: A string CONVERSATION
Output
print Narrator if the last one was Narrator, Tyler if the last one was Tyler and If what you're given, has no snaps, it's not a conversation, but a monologue. In such cases, you must output None of them
Constraints
0 <= quantity of snaps <= 6
Example
Input
Whoa, wait, this is crazy. You want me to hit you? *Snap* That’s right.
Output
Tyler
